content.description: Big flakes and a couple of ledge stances.
content.location: Just left of the top of the grassy hill, climber's left of Dogtown (~40 feet away).

content.description:
This starts just right of the Pet Arete and finishes at a separate anchor near the Pet Arete anchor.  Can easily be toproped from the top of Pet Arete.

A 5.11ish start on ok rock lead to several very sharp monos up the wall.  Very little chalk seems to indicate very few ascents... given the sharp monos I guess I see why.

Crux boulder problem off the ground. The first bolt is a directional. I recommend pre-clipping the second bolt as well. The third clip isn't terrible, but if you blow the clip with rope out it may be a close call. After the boulder problem intro through the bulge climb into the dihedral, shake out on some jugs and continue to top of dihedral and exit up and slightly left onto technical slab.
content.location: Wildflower Royale is right of White Lotus (.13c) and left of Passion Party (.10c).

content.description: White Lotus is a short power route with no real stopping points from the moment you leave the ground.  Pinches, bad feet, long moves and hard clips make up the majority of this route.   Start with the first 2 bolts preclipped.

climbs.name: Where Are They Gonna Run When Destruction Comes

content.description: Right of Cloud Calling. A hard and greasy flake thing to a cooler and easier roof.

Pretty good route, worth doing just for the crazy start.

Starts on an overhanging arete with some burly layaway moves, then gets up to some thin pockets.

Pretty fun and worth doing - most of the really good climbing is in the first half of the route but overall it is a nice line.
content.location: 1 route right of Happy Wheel, the obvious bolted crack

content.description:
This is a fun and well-protected route up an arete.  Tricky footwork is most of the issue here...

Eases up about 2/3 the way up.  Nice Line!
content.location: Left of the obvious Happy Wheel crack there are a couple of difficult face routes.  On the left edge of this wall is the fairly obvious arete climb.

content.description: Technical face climb on vertical rock to small roof. Start with huge detached flake at base of wall and climb through positive crimps to get to the small roof, then pull a couple pockets and jugs to the anchors. Some may find the third bolt is a little far left from the sequence, but it goes. Fun route.
content.protection: Five (5) clips. Fixe rings for anchors.
content.location: Passion Party is left of Z-Boys(5.7) and just to the right of Wildflower.

content.description: to the right of "dog town".  start off a flake on the ground and pull hard, one move wonder on a slab of sorts

The namesake route for this little cliff, although you could make the argument that this cliff is really part of the Briskets area...but I digress.

Anyway, this route is a decent route although nothing too exciting.  No difficult moves and a couple of sort of odd clips - worth doing if you are there but certainly nothing to seek out.

Follows a crack to a face in a shallow open book.  For a better "bolted crack" climb, go do More Funky than Gunky, not far away.
content.location: center of the Happy Wheel wall, fairly soon after coming up the trail that comes out at Addiction wall if you walk toward Killer Cave.

climbs.name: Dreaming the Rasta Bus
climbs.fa: Bob Branscomb, with Tom and Kristen from Boulder  April 2010

content.description: A good route starting on a flake, hence up on jugs and pockets to a thin section below an undercling.  Crux getting past the undercling to the fifth bolt (step a bit right then lay away to nice pocket up left)
Fun climb starting on a right-facing corner, then up to bigger holds above.
content.location: Just uphill (climber's left) of Hunger Force.  Or, two routes left of Bones Brigade.

content.description:
This line tackles a sharp patch of flowstone on the otherwise unremarkable wall left of Happy Wheel.  The climbing is technical and reachy, with a few big spans and thin holds.

Begin with the easiest moves on the route, follow a series of flakes to reach the second bolt.  Weave between features, utilizing a few thin crimps and big gaston moves.  Near the end, pumpy pockets lead up and left to the Yellow Cake anchor.
content.protection: ~5 bolts to a shared anchor with Yellow Cake (to the left).
content.location: The second route left of the Happy Wheel dihedral, climbing a reddish streak of prickly stone.

content.description: Lander Sport Climbs says this is 65' and has a picture indicating as much.  We found anchors about 45' up and slightly to the left, with no apparent bolts higher.  Short, crimpy 10a, with crux at the bottom, and an easier crack 3/4 of the way up.
content.location:
Get "Lander Sport Climbs," (2007).  Find #83.

Otherwise, I'll never be able to get you there (since this is currently the only problem on the wall) :)
